item.title: Baby Waluigi Cries Waaaah In Mario Tennis Fever
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo has released a new overview trailer for Mario Tennis Fever, the upcoming sports game for Switch 2. While the video goes over various modes and special rackets, the most important revelation is Baby Waluigi. He's a real playable character, and he's spectacular.

Baby Waluigi isn't the only newcomer to Mario Tennis Fever, though. The game will feature Goomba, Nabbit, Piranha Plant, and Baby Wario for the first time as part of the playable cast, consisting of 38 characters overall. The sports title will also serve up 30 Fever Rackets. Nintendo showcased some of the special abilities tied to these frames, such as the Pokey Racket and Golden Dash Racket. The former spawns enemies on your opponent's court, while the latter can make your character super agile.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Mario Tennis Fever â€“ Official Gameplay Overview Trailer

Nintendo also detailed how to counter Fever shots. If players can volley the ball back--meaning not allowing it to bounce off the court--the special effect can be sent back. For instance, the Ice Racket creates a frozen surface on the court. Instead of this slippery area appearing on your side, you can volley the Fever shot back to your opponent.

Other tidbits from the new Mario Tennis Fever video include the fact that Fever Rackets can be disabled for more straightforward matches. In addition, the Switch 2 title has GameShare capabilities, letting nearby players on Switch 2 and Switch join multiplayer matches locally without a copy of the game.

Mario Tennis Fever is set to launch February 12, and preorders are live for the Switch 2 exclusive. It's the first entry in the Mario spin-off series since Mario Tennis Aces in 2018.

item.title: Xbox Developer Direct Returns January 22 With Fable And Forza Horizon 6
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft has confirmed that the next Developer Direct livestream will be broadcast on January 22 at 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET. This is the fourth Developer Direct to date, and, as with previous livestreams, viewers can expect updates and new gameplay for several upcoming titles.

This year also marks the 25th anniversary of the Xbox brand, and Microsoft has confirmed that Playground Games will show off gameplay footage for Forza Horizon 6 and a new look at the long-in-development Fable.

Pokemon developer Game Freak will also reveal more of its upcoming game Beast of Reincarnation. More details about the game's protagonist, Emma, and her ability to manipulate plants in the dangerous landscape of post-apocalyptic Japan will be revealed.

The year ahead looks to be a big one for Xbox, as Microsoft is also releasing Halo: Campaign Evolved for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. Beyond Xbox, 2026 also marks the 40th anniversary of Bethesda and the 35th anniversary of Blizzard.

We'll also see the return of BlizzCon in September, and Blizzard has teased that 2026 will be its "biggest" year yet.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: New Life Is Strange Game Leaked By European Ratings
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The story of Max Caulfield and her best friend, Chloe Price, was a major part of the original Life is Strange, and the pair are apparently about to reunite. The Pan-European Game Information has seemingly leaked the next game in the series, Life is Strange: Reunion, which looks to bring Max and Chloe back together for the first time in years.

In the original game, Max used her powers to rewind time to save Chloe's life, only to face a choice between saving her friend or saving their hometown. Chloe wasn't a featured character in the most recent game, Life is Strange: Double Exposure, but the PEGI rating for Reunion reveals that both of the game's heroines are facing some serious trials ahead.

"Chloe Price was Max Caulfield's partner in time," reads the game's description. "Losing her is Max's greatest regret. Now Chloe has come to Caledon University. Haunted by nightmares and impossible memories, Chloe needs Max's help. But Max is already in crisis: in three days, a deadly inferno will destroy the campus."

The PEGI rating notes that most of the violence in the game is implied, and that there are some swear words. It also specifically notes a scene where the player's character has the option of accepting wine to drink before realizing that it was spiked with a hallucinogen.

Square Enix will release Life is Strange: Reunion on PS5 according to the rating, which doesn't mention PC or Xbox Series X|S. Presumably an official announcement of the game will be made soon.

Late last year, Prime Video ordered a Life is Strange TV series. However, the original creators of the game are apparently not involved in the show.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
